metadata.title: Physical Forcing of Marine Productivity: Monitoring Moorings on the Gulf of Alaska Shelf

creators.name: University of Alaska Fairbanks (UAF), School of Fisheries
Ocean Sciences (SFOS), Institute of Marine Science (IMS)

metadata.description:
We will be studying links between physical forcing due to meteorological conditions and the temperature, salinity, velocity structure, nutrient and chlorophyll levels, and
sinking of particulate matter. We plan to place two closely spaced moorings on the shelf of the Gulf of Alaska about 60 km offshore of Seward. One mooring will monitor temperature, salinity and horizontal velocities, and the other will monitor surface meteorological conditions, nitrate levels, sinking particulate matter, fluorescence and light levels. This study, in conjunction with the present GLOBEC monitoring study in the Gulf of Alaska, will permit us to understand the relation between physical forcing and higher trophic levels (marine mammals, birds, and fish).

This project also includes;

Susan Henrichs 
University of Alaska Fairbanks

Terry Whitledge
University of Alaska Fairbanks

An NPMR project
